text:
Hey Callum!
apologies for not getting back sooner!
This is great to hear. I hope you do find an internship with one of the large vfx companies.

Lets look at what you have been working on.
This is coming together 
-I like the moody look that you are going for
broken glass/foliage are definitely helping.

-maybe you could work on making it dusty, grimy, old. how about a spec breakup and dirt especially on glass.

-whats the area of interest?
make it stand out(expose up). look at some real photography on flickr or in a movie.
if this was a set there would be softbox hidden off camera making that cloth brighter 

-color contrast: adding some blues in shadows (lift/offset) and some more color in the moonlight(blue gain) would make the opposite colors of the foliage standout. 
Just have fun with colors. make a contact sheet.

-let some dust catch highlights/bloom


nice exploration with depth displacement.

backlit shots are fun to work on.
what are you doing with the shot here?

for sure! look forward to seeing what you come up with next semester.


for a shoot try your best to plan as much as possible. if you can do some tests(with the same camera, smartphone or a crude sketch) would be super helpful to foresee problems.

some unexpected things can happen when you shoot.
improvise!
avoid big problems.

get the exposure right.
if you can get something in camera its always better
goodluck! keep me posted how everything goes. feel free to send in what you have been upto
